articles.title: Yemen's southern separatists pull out of Riyadh agreement committees
articles.description: Southern separatists in Yemen have pulled out of committees implementing a November agreement to end a power struggle in the south that had opened a new front in the country's multifaceted war.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Southern separatists in Yemen have pulled out of committees implementing a November agreement to end a power struggle in the south that had opened a new front in the country’s multifaceted war.

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul and Laila Bassam
articles.title: Ghosn met Lebanese president after fleeing Japan: sources
articles.description: Fugitive former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn met Lebanon's president after his escape from Japan, where he was smuggled out of house arrest by a private security company, two sources close to Ghosn said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
BEIRUT (Reuters) - Fugitive former Nissan chairman Carlos Ghosn met Lebanon’s president after his escape from Japan, where he was smuggled out of house arrest by a private security company, two sources close to Ghosn said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Tunisia PM-designate submits government to president: presidency office
articles.description: Tunisia's designated prime minister Habib Jemli has submitted a proposed cabinet to President Kais Saied, the office of the presidency said on Wednesday on its Facebook page without giving details.
articles.content:
TUNIS (Reuters) - Tunisia’s designated prime minister Habib Jemli has submitted a proposed cabinet to President Kais Saied, the office of the presidency said on Wednesday on its Facebook page without giving details.

articles.title: Hong Kong delays football fixtures during unrest

articles.title: Fugitive Ghosn met Lebanon president after escape
articles.description: Nissan's former boss and international fugitive Carlos Ghosn is said to have been smuggled out of Japan by an undisclosed private security company. Reuters sources say he was personally received by Lebanon's own president after arriving in the Mideast.

articles.title: Death of Georgia Tech recruit hit by train ruled a suicide
articles.description: The death of a Georgia Tech football recruit who was struck by a freight train was ruled a suicide by the Broward County (Fla.) medical examiner's office, according to multiple reports.

articles.title: U.S. embassy in Baghdad suspends consular operations: statement
